IS UBER QUIETLY POSITIONING ITSELF AS THE AUTONOMY DARK HORSE?

Since Tesla‚Äôs robotaxi launch on Sunday:
‚Ä¢ $UBER +12%
‚Ä¢ $TSLA +2%

Something‚Äôs shifting.

While the spotlight was on Tesla, Uber quietly became the stealth AI mobility trade. 

Prospero‚Äôs short-term net sentiment score is clocking in above 90 -- and now there‚Äôs buzz that former CEO Travis Kalanick is back in the mix, reportedly in talks to help fund a takeover of $PONY, a leading autonomous driving startup.

If true, this would be huge. Uber‚Äôs first push into autonomy stalled years ago. But with Kalanick re-engaged -- and a new shot at owning the tech in-house -- this could be the moment the original vision gets revived.

Suppose Trump picks Fed Governor Chris Waller, a current member of the FOMC. In that case, he expects Waller to start lobbying for rate cuts immediately ‚Äì essentially holding the FOMC hostage, twisting arms, and doing whatever is necessary to get the Fed to cut rates now. 

If Waller cannot do this, then he‚Äôs not up for the job according to Trump‚Äôs standards. Is Waller ready for this Hobbesian choice? Is the Fed prepared for a potential onslaught from within starting very soon?

If Trump picks an outsider, like Warsh or Hassett, they have far less power until they actually become Fed chair in May 2026. The Fed has time to prepare.

Bonus 3

The Midwest and Northeast have more stringent building and land code regulations. This is driven by Boomers who want to limit supply to preserve their home values from being diluted. 

The South and West are more builder-friendly.

Bonus 2

Worse, 85% of new home sales are in the South and West. 

Approximately 60% of the population resides in the Midwest and Northeast, yet they account for only about 15% of new home sales.

Bonus 1

How do we help buyers? More supply. Housing starts are still not close to the pre-housing peak/financial crisis levels.

Less regulation would help.

4/4

If housing has problems, why aren't prices declining?

Cutting rates and sellers can/will raise prices to offset any mortgage relief for buyers. 

Sellers don't need the help; buyers do. Rate cuts will not help buyers.

3/4

Redfin's measure is not a fluke, as the national Case-Shiller Home Price Index is also at an all-time high.

Home prices are booming, benefiting homeowners/sellers.

2/4

This is my favorite metric of home prices because it adjusts for the size of the house.

Redfin downloads every multiple listing service (MLS)  across the country to calculate their median.

Prices are at a new all-time high.

1/4

I would argue that if the Fed cuts rates and you assume mortgage rates follow the federal funds rate lower (they may NOT be the case), home prices would rise, putting the monthly payment right back at $2,860.

The distribution rate = Latest distribution annualized / current NAV

The 30-day SEC yield is a standardized measure of the income earned by a fund, typically a bond fund or ETF, over a 30-day period, annualized to provide an estimated annual return.

* The Distribution Rate and 30-Day SEC Yield is not indicative of future distributions, if any, on the ETFs. In particular, future distributions on any ETF may differ significantly from its Distribution Rate or 30-Day SEC Yield. You are not guaranteed a distribution under the ETFs. Distributions for the ETFs (if any) are variable and may vary significantly from month to month and may be zero. Accordingly, the Distribution Rate and 30-Day SEC Yield will change over time, and such change may be significant. The distribution may include a combination of ordinary dividends, capital gain, and return of investor capital, which may decrease a fund‚Äôs NAV and trading price over time. As a result, an investor may suffer significant losses to their investment. These distribution rates caused by unusually favorable market conditions may not be sustainable. That is such a weak attempt at a HS chart. 

1. 30 minute time frame? My rule of thumb is try and match chart times with holding expectations. If you plan to hold something for weeks, use weekly. If days, use daily. Thus this chart is only useful for someone day trading gold. 

2. You really should have a volume confirmation on a H&S. 

3. It‚Äôs just plainly not a clean H&S, it‚Äôs a big stretch at it. One may even argue a double bottom with trend reversal at the end.
